name: EART 126
title: Geomechanics
description: An integration of rock mechanics, geophysics, fluid flow, and geology to quantify stress state in the subsurface. Covers a range of topics including: basic constitutive laws for stress and strain, tectonic stress fields, the effects of fluids on rock and fault strength, natural and human-induced hydrofracture, human-induced seismicity, fault, drilling techniques for determining subsurface physical rock properties, and fault zones drilling.

pre_req_data.text: Prerequisite(s): PHYS 5A or PHYS 6A, and EART 110B.
